intro: Mitrasacme elata, commonly known as the tall mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
